ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: i would certainly recommend it to any student trying to figure out how to actually do statistical work (i.e most other courses firmly stop at the theory and leave all software computations to individual learning or ad hoc implementation). The practical skills offered in this course are the salient strengths
SOCY580 is a statistics course that covers all the basics of statistics with a particular focus on the OLS model. Assignments include a weekly problem set that is completed with STATA software.
I would recommend it as a great intro to a very useful skill set.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Reinforced important foundational elements of statistics and provided an excellent formal introduction to the associated computer programming and practice of statistical analysis

As an undergraduate student aspiring to enroll in graduate school and conduct my own research, I must say that SOCY580 was an amazing opportunity. With Chris's encouragement, I am happy that I took and completed the course. Not only did the course serve as a way to deepen my knowledge of statistics at a higher level, but it also allowed meto see what to expect in an academic community, particularly in a Sociology department. The class expanded my knowledge on multiple levels.
